page.title: 06Widmerpool Hall (2)
page.content: Widmerpool Hall is used as the Nation- al Training Centre for the Automobile Association (AA). The AA bought the hall and 8 hectares of wooded parkland in 1950 to use as a Patrol Service Training Establishment. In 1973, after construction of new buildings, a tech- nical workshop and extended catering services, it became the National Train -ing Centre for all staff training. Building in the grounds has continued and in 1985 there were 108 single study bedrooms, enlarged technical workshops, lecture rooms, recreational facilities and the Crombie Memorial Club. Students attend the Training Centre from all parts of the UK and Eire. There are 75 permanent staff and two live on the premises; the rest mainly live in the S. Notts. area. The hall has been refurbished and equipped to modern standards.
